name: Club Med Tignes Val Claret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just finished our 3 year visit to Club Med Tignes Val Claret. It has been completely re furbished. It has moved up a star to 4 star. We love the experience that Club Med gives you. They organise it all and you have nothing to worry about as everything is included in the price. The flights from Britain are around 90 to 120 minutes and the transfer time from the airport to the resort, weather permitting is around 165 minutes.
reviews.title: Even better than last year

reviews.text: The Bedroom - I have posted some photos which represents a club room. If you look further down the traveller photos you will see mine from last year which will let you see the changes. They have replace all the bedroom fittings and gave the rooms a lovely cosy feel. The décor was really nice, the beds were comfortable but you are rarely in the room. Down side they have changed the heating from oil to electric. It was controlled from a central control room which was not good as we had a faulty patio door sensor which caused the heating to stay off, so the room was a little chilly and when it did work it was very drying. The oil heating was much more comfortable. The lighting in the bedroom is woeful. so dim you can hardly see.
reviews.title: Great family holiday

reviews.text: The Restaurant - was excellent. The hotel now being a four star now serves 4 star food which was really good they have food to suits all tastes from kids to a la carte dinners. Wine was served in abundance as well as beer and soft drinks. The décor was modern and the dinning room was well lit and spacious. The waiting staff were always on hand and very helpful.
reviews.title: Flat out hedonism
Absolutely Fab Skiing!
reviews.text: The Bar - they have now put a stage in the bar so that you can see the evening's entertainment, instead of going into the theatre which has now been changed into additional seating for the bar.

The Spa - we had a massage (extra cost) on the third day and it was wonderful. The spa is a little dated as it hasn't been modernised but it is fine. They have a pool and Turkish bath but we didn't use either of them this year, but previously they were grand. To improve it would be nice to have a jacuzzi.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Club Med!!

likes.liked: — the food was fantastic, the staff were great, and nothing was too much trouble
likes.disliked: — there wasnt anything not to like!!

reviews.text: Before my trip to Club Med Val Claret I was expecting the worst as I happen to have read the previous reviews on this site. Well they could have not been more wrong. WE had a family room with piste view wihch was spacious with nice bathroom and seperate toilet. Let me start with the food, it was excellent , varied, fresh and diverse. The wine at the table was accpetable and easy flowing. The staff at the restaurant where accomodating. Like all club med resorts drinks at the bar are free and the staff behind the bar where excellent, fast service even when the bar was at its busiest. The GOs where very helpfull, expecially when my eldest son broke his wrist, I was 2 hours away and they took him to hospital, waited with him and brougth him back to the club and enteratained him till i arrrived. The lady named Leila was excellent and kind hearted. Also thumbs up to the Genral Manager Jean Marc and his assistant Jacklin, always took our minor complainst seriously and made sure we where happy througout. Granted the resort is now old, (It will be refurrbished this summer) but if you seek a family holiday , relaxed, ski in ski out, great food, fun entertainment, well club med val claret was a good experience.
reviews.title: Lovely club med experience

reviews.text: This hotel is in major need of a total refurbishment. It just plain and simply looks old and tired.It completely lacks any sort of character whatsoever.
reviews.title: never again

likes.disliked: — horrendous noise from piste bashers all through the night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bedroom was an adequate size though it was virtually impossible to open the balcony doors without severely pulling ones muscles. Decor in the room was woeful. One wall was painted a peculiar shade of blue which was very unwelcoming. There was not even a single painting on any of the walls. On the plus side was a small but fairly comfy bath which is always appreciated on a ski hol. I might add that we had paid for a deluxe room! I understand from friends we went with that the single rooms were reminiscent of the cabins on the Dublin ferry!!
reviews.title: club hell

likes.disliked: — the accomodation was the worse ever and the staff that dont speak basic english

aka: Club Med Tignes Val Claret Hotel Tignes
description: The Village of Tignes Val Claret, nestled at an altitude of 2127 meters in the heart of an immaculate paradise, looks out over the magnificent surrounding massifs : Grande Motte, Grande Casse, Mont-Blanc and Grande-Sassière. Devoted to skiing in winter and summer alike, it is one of the legendary resorts for all snow sports fanatics. The Village lets you explore its slalom, mogul runs and snow parks. After a day's intense skiing relax with a sauna, Turkish bath, stretching and Club Med Spa*
